intro: Notylia microchila, commonly known as the small-lobed flax, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, narrow leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers that are clustered in dense, spherical heads, typical of the daisy family. Notylia microchila thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
